definitions: hard glossy coating made from refined lac resin dissolved in alcohol used for wood finishing
examples: The antique table was restored with several coats of shellac
She applied shellac to seal the wooden cabinet doors

definitions: explosive artillery shells fired continuously during military combat or warfare
examples: The soldiers took cover from the intense shellfire overhead
The city endured weeks of devastating shellfire during the siege

definitions: edible water-dwelling creatures with shells including mollusks and crustaceans
examples: The restaurant specializes in fresh shellfish like oysters and lobster
She developed an allergy to shellfish after eating shrimp

definitions: bombardment with explosive shells from artillery weapons
process of removing outer shells from nuts, peas, or similar foods
examples: The village suffered heavy shelling throughout the night
Constant shelling forced civilians to flee their homes
She spent the afternoon shelling peas for dinner
The machine makes shelling walnuts much faster and easier

definitions: person who tends and guards sheep in pastures or fields
religious leader who guides and cares for a congregation
examples: The shepherd led his flock to fresh grazing grounds
The old shepherd knew every sheep in his care by name
The pastor served as a faithful shepherd to his congregation
She was a shepherd to troubled youth in the community

definitions: frozen dessert made with fruit juice, sugar, and sometimes milk or cream
examples: The children enjoyed orange sherbet on the hot summer day
She served raspberry sherbet between dinner courses to cleanse palates

definitions: informal term for detective derived from Sherlock Holmes character
examples: Stop playing sherlock and let the police handle this case
Every amateur sherlock in town tried solving the mysterious disappearance

definitions: fortified wine from Spain ranging from dry to sweet varieties
examples: She poured a glass of dry sherry before dinner
The recipe calls for two tablespoons of cooking sherry

definitions: material or structure that blocks harmful radiation, electromagnetic fields, or other dangers
examples: The reactor requires thick concrete shielding to contain radiation
Electronic devices need proper shielding to prevent signal interference

definitions: mechanical device for changing gears in vehicles or machinery
person who moves or changes position of things regularly
examples: The truck's gear shifter needed urgent repair after breaking
She preferred cars with automatic shifters over manual ones
The warehouse hired additional shifters for the busy season
Night shifters moved inventory while the store was closed

definitions: continuous movement or change in position, direction, or condition
examples: The shifting of tectonic plates causes earthquakes over time
Political shifting in public opinion influenced the election results

definitions: former British monetary unit worth one twentieth of a pound
examples: His grandfather collected old shillings from the Victorian era
The book cost three shillings when first published in 1920

definitions: thin wedge or strip used to fill gaps or adjust spacing
examples: The carpenter inserted a wooden shim under the wobbly table
Door frames often require shims to ensure proper alignment

definitions: soft wavering light that seems to move on a surface
examples: The lake created a beautiful shimmer in the moonlight
Heat waves caused a shimmer above the desert highway

definitions: dance characterized by rapid shaking of shoulders and hips
abnormal shaking or vibration in mechanical parts
examples: She performed an energetic shimmy during the jazz performance
The 1920s dance craze featured the popular shimmy move
The car developed a dangerous shimmy at high speeds
Front wheel shimmy indicated the need for tire balancing

definitions: front part of leg between knee and ankle containing the tibia
examples: He bruised his shin badly on the coffee table corner
Soccer players often wear guards to protect their shins

definitions: bruised swollen area around eye caused by impact or blow
examples: The boxer sported an impressive shiner after the championship fight
She covered her shiner with makeup before the important meeting

definitions: thin rectangular tile used for covering roofs or walls
mass of small smooth stones on seashore or riverbank
examples: The storm damaged several shingles on the garage roof
Cedar shingles give the house a traditional New England appearance
Children collected shells along the shingle at low tide
Waves crashed noisily against the shingle beach all night

definitions: act or state of giving off bright light or being luminous
examples: The shining of stars filled the clear desert sky
Her shining example inspired others to volunteer their time

definitions: person or company that designs and constructs ships and boats
examples: The experienced shipbuilder supervised construction of the new ferry
Korean shipbuilders dominate the global cargo vessel market today

definitions: industry and process of designing and constructing ships and marine vessels
examples: The coastal city has a long tradition of shipbuilding excellence
Modern shipbuilding requires advanced engineering and specialized facilities

definitions: quantity of goods sent together as cargo from one place to another
examples: The overseas shipment arrived two weeks later than expected
Each shipment requires proper documentation and tracking numbers

definitions: person or company that owns ships used for commercial purposes
examples: The wealthy shipowner expanded her fleet with three new tankers
Greek shipowners control a significant portion of global shipping

definitions: person or company that sends goods by ship, truck, or other transport
examples: The shipper arranged for express delivery of the urgent package
International shippers must comply with customs regulations carefully

definitions: business of transporting goods by sea, air, or land
all ships belonging to a country or port
examples: Online retailers offer free shipping on orders over fifty dollars
The company specializes in international shipping of fragile items
The strait is a major route for commercial shipping traffic
Wartime shipping losses severely impacted the nation's economy

definitions: remains of ship destroyed by sinking or running aground
examples: Divers discovered a centuries-old shipwreck containing Spanish gold
The museum displays artifacts recovered from local shipwreck sites

definitions: skilled worker who builds and repairs wooden ships and boats
examples: The shipwright carefully shaped oak planks for the vessel's hull
Traditional shipwrights pass their knowledge through apprenticeship programs

definitions: place where ships are built, maintained, and repaired
examples: The naval shipyard employs thousands of skilled workers
The old shipyard was converted into a waterfront shopping district

definitions: traditional county division in Britain, especially in rural areas
examples: The family estate sprawled across three shires in central England
Yorkshire remains one of England's most recognizable historic shires

definitions: crude knife or stabbing weapon made from available materials
examples: Prison guards discovered a shiv hidden in the cell wall
The detective found a makeshift shiv at the crime scene

definitions: seven-day Jewish mourning period observed after death of close relative
examples: The family sat shiva for their grandmother at her home
Friends brought food during shiva to comfort the bereaved family

definitions: involuntary shaking movement caused by cold, fear, or excitement
examples: A cold shiver ran down her spine during the ghost story
The puppy's shiver prompted them to bring it inside immediately

definitions: ongoing involuntary shaking typically from cold temperature or strong emotion
examples: The shivering of leaves warned of the approaching storm
His uncontrollable shivering required immediate medical attention

definitions: shallow area in body of water that poses navigation hazard
large group of fish swimming together
examples: The ship's captain carefully navigated around the dangerous shoal
Low tide exposed the rocky shoal near the harbor entrance
A massive shoal of sardines attracted dolphins and seabirds alike
Fishermen spotted a shoal moving through the clear coastal waters

definitions: event or news that causes great surprise or shock
examples: The election results were a real shocker to political analysts
The movie's ending delivered a shocker nobody saw coming

definitions: cheap inferior fabric made from recycled wool or cotton waste
examples: The jacket fell apart quickly due to its shoddy construction
Wartime shortages led to widespread use of shoddy in clothing

definitions: person who makes or repairs shoes and other footwear professionally
examples: The village shoemaker crafted custom boots for each customer
Traditional shoemakers still use hand tools passed down through generations

definitions: cord or string used to fasten shoes
very small or inadequate amount of money
examples: His shoestring came untied during the important presentation
She replaced the worn shoestrings with bright new ones
The startup operated on a shoestring budget for two years
They produced an impressive film on a shoestring of ten thousand

definitions: ram's horn blown as musical instrument in Jewish religious ceremonies
examples: The rabbi blew the shofar to mark the Jewish New Year
The ancient shofar produces a distinctive penetrating sound

definitions: Japanese board game similar to chess with unique pieces and rules
examples: Professional shogi players train for years to master complex strategies
The grandfather taught his grandchildren shogi on rainy afternoons

definitions: hereditary military dictator who ruled Japan before the Meiji Restoration
examples: The powerful shogun controlled Japan for over two centuries
Tokugawa Ieyasu became shogun after winning the Battle of Sekigahara

definitions: system of military government under a shogun in feudal Japan
examples: The Tokugawa shogunate isolated Japan from foreign influence for centuries
The shogunate maintained strict social hierarchy throughout the country

definitions: traditional Japanese sliding door or room divider with translucent paper panels
examples: Soft light filtered through the shoji screens into the tea room
The artist painted delicate cherry blossoms on the shoji panels

definitions: set of staves and headings for assembling casks or barrels
examples: The cooper ordered several shooks to make wine barrels
Shipping shooks saved space compared to assembled barrels

definitions: person who uses firearms or takes photographs
small glass of liquor meant to be consumed quickly
examples: The skilled shooter won three gold medals at the Olympics
Police identified the shooter from security camera footage
The bartender lined up tequila shooters for the birthday group
She ordered a round of shooters to celebrate the promotion

definitions: exchange of gunfire between opposing groups
sports tiebreaker where players take alternating shots
examples: The western movie climaxed with a dramatic shootout at noon
Police engaged in a dangerous shootout with bank robbers
The hockey game went to a shootout after overtime ended scoreless
The penalty shootout determined which team advanced to finals
